content: One of the best apps I was transitioning into c# I just wanted to see the synatx quick sometimes , the thing with this app is it lets you go through the modules any time , while other apps , you'll have to progress.

Pleeeeeeeaaaaaase make this app less complimentary and more a fully adapted UI of the web version? I'm so frequently on the move I'd so love to get more practise done! But you're only giving me revision üòû I just want 5 minutes of progress every so often to keep up the habit. We pay you for that much...
Love the company, not a fan of the app. Doesn't really sync up to progress on the web version.
layout on point, information straight forward intuitive and easy to understand.
This app has been helping me practice coding on my phone! Rather than going on social media I open up this app whenever I have free time.

Can only sign up with google or facebook. Oh, and if signing up with google account, which is signed in on same device, still asks for the password instead of sending verification email. The whole point of signing up/in with google was to not have to remember all these flipping passwords!
As a beginner, the first lesson was quite tasking. Didn't seem so beginner friendly or maybe I started from the wrong point.

Okay but needs work. Everytime you start "from the beginning" it's never the same course and I don't like that very much. I would prefer a structured platform with very clear levels of progress and an ability to go back and learn the basics again to sharpen up on those details.

I thought to myself YAY. A mobile IDE to do EXACTLY what I do on the PC but on the go. I was EXTREMELY disappointed beyond measure. This application is useless. If this application cost $0.25 to use. I'd tell people to save their money. For some reason I don't want to delete the app. But I'm not going to use it for a long time. The only purpose this icon does on my phone is remind me to use the website at all. And I'm probably going to find something else to use instead.

I was hoping for the full version since I paid for the subscription. I was led to believe that I could actually practice on the go, that is not the case. It's more of a study tool. Since I don't always have my laptop with me, I figured I could download the app to my tablet or phone and continue to do the lessons. It was disappointing to find out that I couldn't. I give two stars for the review content. Practice makes perfection.

Little disappointed to see that the language I had been working on, C, couldn't be done on this app... But it's not bad. The system is great and very user friendly. It took me like a minute to login for the first time because all you have to do is just click the login with email button. But I was really hoping to have C be in the language list and it's not.

This is perfect to keep your streak going when you cant get to your pc however the randomized lessons without context for the practice lessons is terribly confusing especially if it gives you questions not related to the 5 pieces of "flashcards" or when you havent gone over the entirety of all the material in that particular lesson and i become lost on what would be the correct answer
Simple straight to the point but not too advanced To overcomplicate Keeps to improving the person not expecting everything at once

While presumably far from the depth (and commitment!) of a CS degree, Codecademy is an easy entry point to learning popular programming languages. Delivered in bite-sized, and addictive, chunks of info, projects, puzzles, and quizzes, Codecademy provides the tactile feedback and quick dopamine rewards (‚úÖ, üëçüëè'yay!'s, 'you got it!', 'Completed!') that make learning something you can do while pooping. Note: I hope to see fresh content regularly added, or I'm changing this review to 4 stars.

As much as this costs for pro subscription this is really terrible. This isn't the quality of other free options and I'm very disappointed, I'm going to suggest to others to look elsewhere for their educational needs.
Great app although coding is difficult. I can practice on the go at work and break times.
I started a course on desktop. Thought i could continue with course on the app. But it didn't sync my progress with the app. I'm not starting over. Nope.
iam student in 12 th and learning python this app makes me understand the basic to pro.... if iam wrong at any point it Requotioned me again and again üëçüèªüëçüèª
I have the PRO version of Codecademy on my desktop and this is a very good way to ensure that you maintain the habit of coding. Thank you üëçüèº

Good for a quick on the go review or to keep your daily streak going and that's it. It's all flash cards and fill in the blanks and the card packs that you get repeat all the time. Several user created cards end up in your study packs and half the time they are straight up garbage with incorrect answers or no way to properly solve the problem. Don't fool yourself into thinking you are learning and look elsewhere for more serious study. App receives no updates. Don't bother.

1. THIS IS ONLY: flashcards and notes from the website readings that prepare you to write physical code. 2. This IS NOT: a physical programmimg/coding app. 3. YOU DO NOT code in this app. At all. Educated point: At the current stage of this existence, app development and technology, there is no point to this app when there are websites that load faster and provide an easier process for searching for and utilizing knowledge you are seeking for any programming language. Let us code in-app.
Has a long way to go to catch up with their website. Would love for my progress to be synced on all devices, as well as similar lessons/projects. Seems like a "Lite" version of what they offer.

This app sucks. My progress is not synced at all on the browser version. I enrolled in the data science career path, but haven't started it yet. When I log into the app, it say I already have some lessons done and the next step is a review quiz?! But I log back into the browser version and, like it should be, I haven't even started it. There are no lessons done and certainly not a review quiz for something I haven't even learned yet!? Also I can't even unenroll and re-enroll
I like the app so far. I haven't used it in awhile and would like to reset my progress but I don't think the app allows me to. please add this.

I do like Codecademy thier website is amazing especially if you subscribed to Pro, but for the app there needs to be more especially if you are paying for a subscription. There are other apps that will actually let you practice coding and go through the course without needing a computer. This comes in really handing especially when some of us work 50 hours a week and only get to use their apps on breaks most days. Other then that you guys doing a really great job!!!
Can't log-in with LinkedIn account. Now my course progress can't be accessed in the application. :(

Nice application with fun studying UI and I like it b'cus the tutorial I saw on youtube it's very lengthy and some time I can't remember the syntex but with this I can read and I can remember it. Please try this because if you are a coder you can make a habit of reading blogs and research paper to learn it's best app to make this habit üëç

App not good. I cant see a way to continue my courses when I log in. 10/20/2021 Edit: Reinstalled to see if progress has been made. App has not been updated in at least a year. My thoughts are they don't care about users being able to study on the go. 12/2020 Edit: Reinstalled to see if progress had be made on the app. This hasn't been updated in over 8 months. Original issue I had still present...

the content seems to be good, but the inputs for the practices are broken to the point that they only add more confusion. typically, the broken practices are the ones that require selecting multiple blocks of text to complete a code segment.

Wonderful for reviewing but I was really hoping to take my lessons on the go. I work a full time job and on my breaks I would have loved to sneak in some bits of lessons. Instead I'm reviewing with this flashcard like app. For being a Pro member I'm quite disappointed, I expected more. Especially for the amount paid for Code Academy Pro. This app shouldn't even be locked to Pro members for its contents. Maybe if you were to make the actual lesson paths mobile, then it could be locked to Pro.
I cannot sign in or even sign up with my Google account, since I want to synchronizw my progress on PC. Pls check that my device is Xiaomi Mi8

it works as intended, and the content is REALLY good, but I can't give 5/5 as my progress on desktop browser isn't showing here and i cannot continue my full-stack software engineer path... infact, it's not an option on the app. Since that's the content I actually want, the app isn't actually giving me downloaded it for... but it looks pretty, interface is sensible and what content is available works as expected.
Hi there, nice looking app but I can't at all manage to sync it up with my progress on my profile from the computer, and I can't browse the full selection of paths.

Good starting point, but doesn't carry progress from the website and I have not written any code (30 mins of testing) which leads me to believe it's all questions. Hopefully they add the ability to run code in the future.
Very handy to have when you want to pass the time away, and also want a challenge at hand üò∏

Having an application for Pro members is not at all helpful if it does not adhere to the website learning. I thought it was absolutely obvious that if I had a learning subject on the website and I had progressed on it, that the mobile app was a secondary platform that allowed me to continue that learning path, not start a new one o a new practice. Why would I start a new subject or the same subject from scratch if the only thing I'm doing is changing devices? I'm not changing my account, so why?

The app just shows you basic concepts over and over again. Also if you are a beginner, you will learn nothing, because the first thing the app shows is a WITH statement in SQL, which is a difficult starting point.

I love the way codecademy presents their courses with so much empathy and careful consideration for beginners. Attempts are made at every point to create no room for confusion when new terms and concepts are introduced the first time. I also have to say that I like the fact that even for those topics that go beyond the scope of a course, codecademy gives its best by providing helpful resources to look up for better understanding.
No sign up with email address, Forcing the user to use Facebook account or a Google account, probably for getting more of the user's data, very disappointing.
Would've loved to see full-fledged courses such as the website, and also more challenging practice questions.
Good for getting some practice in when you get spare time. I use it to refresh previous instruction after I've progressed to new topics.
simple, nice and easy to use. I hope they restructure the lessons to move in a progressive manner

Very disappointing. Using the web version is great but the app is awful. In almost every practice question section there is at least one question that isn't formated properly to allow you to answer it correctly. Some much needed QA is required.

I pay for Pro and signed up using Google on my laptop. When you log into the app on your phone through Google there's no option to select an account and so I can't use my Pro account! What's the point.

Disappointed with my Pro subscription Multiple UX bugs during exercises: answers do not appear, they stack onto each other, cells don't get filled with the selected answers. Nonetheless, quite a significant number of wrong answers or unclear questions. The reviewing and practice system is just strange. You are being questioned on certain topics and only afterwards you're getting to review the flashcards on that topic. And some other minor bugs; it would be just too lengthy to describe them all.
I like the flow of the lessons and the ability to practice in my phone. I wish I could make progress on lessons through the app, especially to read the articles.

Not responsive, slow, doesn't save progress, the same exercise keeps repeating. Direct login didn't work, keyboard kept disappearing so had to go through another app. Great idea and useful for continued learning on the go but app needs improving.
Not for beginners, assumes some understanding of html. Very brief lessons that do not do a good job explaining it. Should have alot mode explanation and breakdown of things
It would be more productive if when solving the problems we'll be rewarded coins with whom we could buy 'streak freezes' to save our streaks. Otherwise it's an usefull app!
Its a good app... But should have more competitive and complex questions...mean increase in question's complexity would be appreciated....
I like being able to keep my streak alive with the app.

Everything is great about Codecademy, interactive, great content, user-friendly, easy to go through. The only downside, which puts me and some other people off, it seems, is that the PRO version is TOO EXPENSIVE compared with the competition. Also the practice to move some free courses to the PRO VERSION is kind of dodgy.
I'm starting do learn how to code very efficiently. It's a beautiful feeling to complete daily challenges.

It's apparently just for reviewing what you've already done on the web. Disappointing--I'd hoped for learning/continuing courses (isn't this obvious?) and a code playground type of experience like Sololearn. Six review questions and you've earned your wings for the day?...not.
Great. Code academy mobile and web, are exactly what I needed to. I can easily understand the concepts, the explanations are simple and to the point.
doesn't even have php smh, so disappointing
Recently it takes too long to get the app open and many times it just went completely blank after being opened. The user experience is quite disappointing.
Nice way to built skills in programming. Pro version should be cheaper for students. Love the way lesson is progressed.

Its confusing, i started html and i cant help but think this app thinks i know what to do already. I encounter unknown terms and its difficult to understand what they do actually. Like right off the bat there's just a bunch of codes that i cant even break down yet. I took me to straight to the review and practice i dont know why.
Impossible to log in with my social account.
Great way to keep learning when not able progress on my lesson plan
It doesn't start on my OnePlus 7 pro. I just get a black screen with the codecademy logo on it. Big disappointment as you are usually so good.
For a app about programming you think it wouldn't be riddled with bugs to the point it's not usable. Can't even detect that I'm pro, even half the buttons don't work.
I've just downloaded it, but it won't load past the welcome screen. So disappointed.

This is a really good app the fact that I get stuck on a difficult lesson and I really have to think about what type of technical problem I have but then I figure it out also it is very precise so when I do understand I feel smarter coding is fun and a challenge.
App is amazing, practicing during breaks are very helpful
Experience was good would've rated it 5 stars if I could keep the progress I have on the site on my phone

For learning code in small manageable amounts, great. Really like the reminder pop up too, to keep up your streak. Only downside is the crashes, only about 50% of the time I will succeed in getting past the homescreen which is a real shame for such a useful app.
I think it need to do more on the beginner's point of view and be more friendly towards them
Great app, but wish it didn't mirror progress on the desktop site and that you could jump ahead into more advanced concepts
As a basic review application it does its job well, like having virtual flash cards.

I'm new to programming and have just started using code academy , this app is a great companion to the code academy learning experience , it's great to be able to practice anywhere at any time such as break times at work .
Extremely disappointed It crashed immediately after installing.

I do not understand the point, of this app. The quizzes are hard to find and are not organized in an orderly way. I get that you can't type code on an application, but unless you are a diehard codecademy user this is useless unless you are reviewing a lesson. Even then it's not easy to navigate lessons or even see the correct answers for the lessons we need.
Loving the website. However, the app isn't showing a streaks I have on the site. Does the streak only show for pro? Any help?

For everyone complaining that they can't log in because they signed up with social media, you need to reset your account password by using the "I forgot my password" button at the website login. I had to do this because I signed up with github. The app is great once you log in.
i can't sign in on the app, i linked my social media accounts on the website to enable seamless sign-in but i cant find it on the app and i cant do "forget password"
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback! Google and Facebook sign in are now available and should work.

Can you give version 1.8.1 a try in the Google Play store?

content: Not a good app. Some exercises are wrong. If your answer is wrong, it doesn't clarify what your mistake is. Tried just one practice exercise on Python list data type and got disappointed.

I don't understand why it just repeats one review and practice all the time and nothing progresses. I don't think this app is ready and tested, which is kinda sad because they educate people to be developers and they can't manage this? .. Makes me wonder
my progress in the website can't be seen on the app (saw a completely different lessons). Please fix this. Once fixed, I'll change my feedback. Thank you.
After installing and logging in, i was disappointed to find that i couldn't continue from where i currently am on the web version
I would give 5, but after last update ai still have two same packs over and over again in circles. Before I could do some progress because every day I got different pack.
I am reealy dissapointed. You cannot do anything except practice random questions by choosong abcd answers...or buy premium I guess.
To be as to the point as possible, I literally couldn't get past the start up screen
Just gets stuck on the first page with Codecademy. Goes no further so completely pointless.

How this was released in this state, as a paid feature, is beyond me... The first screen doesn't load, pressing any of the tiles in the Catalog screen doesn't trigger anything, and navigating to the Search screen breaks the entire app because the menu disappears and dismissing the new feature notification message doesn't do anything üôÉ
I'm not sure I get the point of this app... My practices go blank after a few questions.. Idk...

The idea is great and attracted a lot of people who want to practice using 
phones . But there is few issues :- #If my phone langauge were arabic all 
the examples gonna looks backwards!! #we want console to test and practice 
. #the app crash five times when i was trying to practice JavaScript !! 
#there is features makes the pro member use the app because we there is no 
console . #The progress of my current courses dose't shows up !! #THE MOST 
ANNOIYING ISSUE IS THAT THE APP CRASH ALL THE TIME ! "This app should be 
coded perfectly like udeamy app and other apps i'm so dispointed

There is this really hard boss called, "set up a reminder" right at the 
start. I tried to use "select time" and "skip" moves but couldn't progress. 
Broken game.
replyContent: Hi Adomas, we'd be happy to help you resolve this issue. Send us an email at support@codecademy.com, including the email address associated with your Codecademy account, and we'll get this taken care of.
